intro: Tricholaena capensis subsp. arenaria, commonly known as the sand lily, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Marantaceae and is characterized by its rosette of broad, fleshy leaves. The plant produces striking, showy inflorescences with brightly colored bracts that resemble flowers. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
